p.s: you have recently told me that you think there were no losers of globalisation and everyone profited from free trade and free market.
I have just read an article about three bloggers who published their experiences of seamstresses in Cambodia.
Since I want to raise your awareness, I will briefly mediate it for you.
The bloggers have spent one day in a garment factory and lived like a native worker.
One states that she had never thought of such a place to exist.
In her opinion, it was not comparable to what the media show.
Another says despaired, she kept doing the same, and questions, what that was a life.
She realises when speaking to the workers, in fact everyone should be equal.
In the end, she states to have learned we were rich because other people were poor.
The bloggers decide to campaign against the exploitation of garment workers in the future due to their experience.
To put it in a nutshell, they are stunned of the workers' situation and can't believe that people have to live in such a place.
I hope I could make you aware of the fact that there aare global issues, too, and you now look from another perspective on free trade and market.
I am looking forward to hearing from you soon!
Is everything fine with school etc.?
